Posted By: chrome_dome (2/22/2014 7:27:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy is a monster in EDH especially as a commander. He instantly takes over the game and if you do not have a repeat way to keep him off the board he just takes over games winning them over and over and over again. Combined with **[Strionic Resonator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Strionic Resonator)** it can turn a paltry 2/2 into a 8/8 every single turn for a mere two mana per turn. He turns **[Balefire Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balefire Dragon)** into a one sided blasphemous act the turn it comes out. if your building an army he turns **[Wild Beastmaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Beastmaster)** with any counters into a instant game winner. I have played against six commander decks using him in MTGO so far and each time they won so quickly it seemed like the rest of the players didn't even get to play. Very very good for aggressive players.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
OK- what if Xengaos is actually just an Innocent Victim in all of this? We could be blowing this 'Stole Power from the Gods' thing waaayyy out of proportion-- Imagine:   
You're just a really fun guy, a party animal in school, and all your friends just LIKE you.   
  
Nex thing you know- they start a cult around you and start sacrificing goats and having orgies in your honor. Well, wouldn't you be tempted to just kind of....live it up and let them carry on?   
  
For this one, I had to branch out from Disney and hit up DreamWorks- hope you all don't mind :)   
  
XENAGOS, GOD OF REVELS' LAMENT- HOW TO SUCCEED AT [BLASPHEMY](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=BLASPHEMY) WITHOUT REALLY TRYING.  
  
**"I Hardly Think I'm *qualified*  
 To come across all [sanctified](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sanctified)  
 I just don't cut it with the *cherubim*.**  
  
[Kiora Atua](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiora Atua): [Xenagos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xenagos), what are you talking about?  
   
  
 There Again! :O They're on their *knees* O:|  
 **Being Worshipped Is A Breeze** :D  
... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Compare to [In the Web of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=In the Web of War). With [In the Web of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=In the Web of War) it's implied that someone would use a token strategy to get as many pumps as possible, with this you can play big fliers and swing in for massive haste damage off the bat. Not only that but, he can be a creature too sometimes.
